articles.title: Chinese Premier Here
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Here
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, arrived here today by special plane to pay an official goodwill visit to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea at the invitation of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government.
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il went to Pyongyang Airport to warmly greet him.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Jong Gak, member of the DPRK NDC and first vice-director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and leading officials of party and power bodies, ministries and national institutions.
					
					 Also seen at the airport were Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials, Chinese guests staying in the DPRK and Chinese students studying here.
					
					 At 10:50 a.m. the plane carrying the friendship mission of the Chinese people touched down at the airport.
					
					 Kim Jong Il firmly shook with Wen Jiabao and cordially hugged him.
					
					 Arriving with Wen Jiabao were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members.
					
					  A ceremony of welcoming Wen Jiabao took place at the airport.
					
					  National anthems of the PRC and the DPRK were played.
					
					  Wen Jiabao together with Kim Yong Il reviewed the guards of honor of the KPA three services.
					
					 A Korean artiste presented a bouquet to Wen.
					
					 Then he, together with Kim Jong Il, Kim Yong Nam and Kim Yong Il, watched the march-past of the guards of honor of the KPA three services.
					
					 Wen waved back to the warmly welcoming crowd shouting such slogans as "Welcome to Wen Jiabao!" and "DPRK-China Friendship!".
					
					 The car carrying him headed for the city.

articles.title: Wen Jiabao's Arrival Statement
articles.content:
Wen Jiabao's Arrival Statement
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, made a written speech upon his arrival in Pyongyang at the airport on Sunday.
					 In the speech he declared that it is the steadfast policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily consolidate and develop the China-DPRK relations of good-neighborly friendship and cooperation.
					
					 Saying that this year is a year of "China-DPRK friendship" marking the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between China and the DPRK, he in the speech, availing himself of the opportunity, expressed the willingness of the Chinese side to give spur to the steady and fresh development of China-DPRK friendship together with the DPRK side and thus bring bigger happiness to the peoples of the two countries and make big contributions to ensuring regional peace and stability.
					
					 He expressed his idea that there would be frank and in-depth exchange of views on China-DPRK relations and matters of common concern during his visit.
					
					 He expressed the conviction that his visit would help boost the traditional friendship between the two parties, two countries and two peoples, promote exchange and cooperation in all fields between the two sides and give an impetus to developing China-DPRK relations of good-neighborly friendship and cooperation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Watches Opera with Chinese Premier
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Watches Opera with Chinese Premier
Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il watched the opera "The Dream of the Red Chamber" with Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK, at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Sunday.
					 When Kim Jong Il entered the auditorium together with Wen Jiabao, all the audience enthusiastically welcomed them with loud applause.
					
					 Present there on invitation to see the performance were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members, Ambassador Liu Xiaoming and staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 The audience included Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Jong Gak, member of the NDC of the DPRK and first vice-director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, leading officials of party, armed forces and power organs, ministries and national institutions and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 The opera, which was produced at the proposal of President Kim Il Sung and under his meticulous guidance nearly half a century ago, is a work adapted from a Chinese famous classic novel. This may have been buried into oblivion but was re-produced as required by the new century thanks to Kim Jong Il who assigned the opera troupe to the task of reproducing the work this year, a year of the "DPRK-China friendship", and gave valuable instructions scores of times.
					
					 The Phibada Opera Troupe honored with the Kim Il Sung Order successfully re-produced the opera, fully reflecting the requirements of the original work.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience for the high artistic talents of the performers.
					
					 Kim Jong Il and Wen Jiabao raised their hands high to warmly acknowledge the enthusiastically cheering performers and audience.
					
					 Wen presented a floral basket to the performers in congratulation of their success.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, Sunday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the sacred temple of Juche, to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					 Visiting the palace with him were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members.
					
					 They were accompanied by Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China.
					
					 Laid before the statue of Kim Il Sung was a floral basket in the name of Wen Jiabao.
					
					 Wen made a bow to Kim Il Sung with reverence for him who provided immortal contribution to the development of the traditional DPRK-China friendship and the cause of global independence.
					
					 He made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK and Chinese Premiers
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK and Chinese Premiers
						
Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Talks between Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, and Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council of China, took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Kim Yong Ho, chief secretary of the Cabinet Secretariat, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China.
					
					 Present from the opposite side were Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					
					 At the talks both sides had a deep-going exchange of views on the matter of invariably developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries. 
					
					 Both sides reaffirmed that the traditional DPRK-China friendship personally provided by leaders of the elder generation of the two countries can never change despite the change of situation and replacement of old generation with new one.
					
					 The DPRK side reaffirmed its stand to further expand and develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with the Chinese side on the occasions of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the diplomatic relations between the DPRK and China and the "year of the DPRK-China friendship".
					
					 Both sides exchanged in an open-hearted manner their opinions on the important international and regional matters of common concern.
					
					 The DPRK side pointed out that the United States is to blame for the occurrence of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and the denuclearization of the peninsula is directly linked with the denuclearization of the whole peninsula and its vicinities and the rest of the world. And it expressed the will to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, the behest of President Kim Il Sung, through bilateral and multilateral dialogues.
					
					 The Chinese side said that over the past six decades after the establishment of diplomatic ties between China and the DPRK the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations have steadily grown stronger in various fields, expressing thanks to the DPRK side for having extended support to China over issues related to the core interests of China including the issue of Taiwan and the issue of Tibet.
					
					 The Chinese side stressed that it sets store by the traditional China-DPRK friendship, adding that it is a steadfast policy of the party and government of China to continue to boost China-DPRK relations of good-neighborly friendship and cooperation.
					
					 Both sides agreed to expand and strengthen the cooperation and exchange in the fields of the economy and trade on the principles of equality and mutual benefit.
					
					 At the talks a consensus of views was reached on the construction of a new bridge over the Amnok River. Both sides officially declared that they would hold ground-breaking ceremony for the building of the bridge at an early date and start relevant work for its earlier construction.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Agreement and Agreed Documents Signed between DPRK and Chinese Governments
articles.content:
Agreement and Agreed Documents Signed between DPRK, Chinese Governments
Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- An agreement and agreed documents between the governments of the DPRK and China were signed at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Kim Yong Ho, chief secretary of the Cabinet Secretariat, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and officials concerned.
					
					 Present from the Chinese side were Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council, Yang Jiechi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, Zhang Ping, minister in charge of the National Development and Reform Commission, Chen Deming, minister of Commerce, Cai Wu, minister of Culture, Xie Fuzhan, director of the Research Office of the State Council, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Qiu Xiaoxiong, vice secretary-general of the State Council and director of the Premier's Office, Wu Dawei, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Liu Zhenqi, deputy director of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and other suite members.
					
					 Signed at the ceremony were the "protocol on the adjustment of treaties between the governments of the DPRK and China," the "agreement on economic and technological cooperation between the governments of the DPRK and China," exchange documents on economic assistance and other agreed documents in the field of economy, an accord on exchange and cooperation between educational organs of the two countries, a MOU on exchange and cooperation in the field of software industry and a protocol on common inspection of export and import goods between the state quality control organs of the two countries, a MOU on tour of the DPRK sponsored by the tourist organizations of China and an accord on strengthening the cooperation in protecting wild animals.

articles.title: Hundreds of Thousands of Pyongyangites Welcome Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Hundreds of Thousands of Pyongyangites Welcome Wen Jiabao
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Pyongyangites warmly welcomed Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China. 
					 Hundreds of thousands of citizens from all walks of life warmly welcomed the goodwill mission of the Chinese people along the tens of kilometers-long route from the Sopho Bridge to Ryonghung crossroads, Kaesonmun Street, Mansudae Street, Yongung Street and Kumsong Street, waving flags of the two countries, bouquets and boards bearing letters "Welcome and Friendship" and "DPRK-China Friendship".
					
					 When the car carrying Wen Jiabao began to head for the main streets of the city, the route was alive with the flower-waving crowd.
					
					 The atmosphere of welcome picked up when a motorcade carrying the guests reached the Friendship Tower.
					
					 The plaza of the Arch of Triumph was crowded with many school children.
					
					 When the motorcade arrived at the plaza, a clarion call was sounded for a ceremony of the Children's Union.
					
					 Children's Union members presented bouquets to Wen Jiabao who got down the car, tied a red neckerchief around his neck and accorded welcome to him on behalf of all the members of the Korean Children's Union.
					
					 The guests waved back to the cheering crowd, passing through streets wrapped in festive mood.
					
					 A general officer and a woman soldier of the Korean People's Army presented bouquets to Wen Jiabao at Jonsung Square.
					
					 The crowd that lined up along Pipha Street warmly congratulated the Chinese people on their successes made in building a harmonious socialist society based on scientific view on development under the leadership of the CPC, shouting slogans welcoming the guests.
					
					 The motorcade carrying the goodwill mission of the Chinese people headed for Kumsong Street amid the enthusiastic welcome of the crowd along the route.
					
					 Working people and youth and students along the route enthusiastically welcomed the guests, shouting "Welcome to Wen Jiabao" and "DPRK-China Friendship" while waving high pennants of the two countries, with the feelings of friendship towards the party, government and people of China who have extended positive support and encouragement to the Korean people in the efforts for building a great prosperous and powerful nation, after setting it as their strategic policy to strengthen the China-DPRK friendship.
					
					 The enthusiastic welcome accorded by Pyongyangites to the Chinese guests powerfully demonstrated the unshakable will of the Korean people to set store by the friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and China and steadily develop them and always advance hand in hand with the Chinese people in the joint struggle for the victory of the socialist cause and global independence as well as the unbreakable DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: Wen Jiabao's Visit to DPRK Welcomed
articles.content:
Wen Jiabao's Visit to DPRK Welcomed
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers Sunday warmly welcome the visit to the DPRK by Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
					 His visit to the DPRK is of weighty significance in view of historical period and political importance, Rodong Sinmun in an editorial notes, and says:
					
					 His visit goes to clearly prove that the Chinese party and government attach great importance to the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 This visit by a goodwill mission of the Chinese people strikingly demonstrates the steadily-developing DPRK-China friendship and gives great encouragement to the Korean people working hard to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.
					
					 Today the DPRK-China friendship is developing with each passing day under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 The Chinese party and government set store by the Sino-DPRK friendship and pay deep attention to consolidating and developing it.
					
					 The Korean people are rejoiced as over their own over the fact that everything is going well in China, and extend firm solidarity to the Chinese people in the efforts to build a harmonious society with Chinese characteristics and reunify the country.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to set store by the traditional DPRK-China friendship and develop it generation after generation. We are convinced that the bilateral friendship will grow stronger by the joint efforts of both sides.
					
					 Wen Jiabao's visit to the DPRK will register a new chapter in the history of the DPRK-China friendship and contribute to promoting the revolution and construction in the two countries.
					
					 Minju Joson editorially stresses that his visit will undoubtedly mark a valuable foundation for the development of the DPRK-China friendly relations.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to President of Vietnam
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to President of Vietnam
Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of sympathy to Nguyen Minh Triet, President of Vietnam, as regards tropical typhoon that hit the country recently, claiming huge human casualties and material losses.
					 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the victims and bereaved families, Kim in the message hoped that the government of Vietnam would stabilize the people's livelihood in the afflicted area as early as possible.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Observed
						
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The October 4 declaration as well as the June 15 joint declaration serves as a great programme for reunification common to the nation and a patriotic banner to be upheld by all Koreans in the struggle for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					 Leading newspapers Sunday stresses this in signed articles dedicated to the 2nd publication anniversary of the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The declaration stipulated that the north and the south would defend and positively implement the June 15 joint declaration, Rodong Sinmun notes, and says:
					
					 The October 4 declaration shines as the banner of independent reunification for carrying into practice the June 15 joint declaration as it reconfirmed the idea of "By our nation itself" whose validity and vitality have been clearly proven through practices in the June 15 era of reunification and called for solving the problem of inter-Korean relations, the reunification problem, on the basis of this idea.
					
					 It is quite possible for the Korean nation to open up a new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity when it acts as indicated by the October 4 declaration.
					
					 It is an urgent requirement of the reality to develop the inter-Korean relations from a new angle and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 All compatriots in the north and the south and overseas should turn out as one in the nationwide struggle to implement the inter-Korean declarations, with awareness and faith that the destiny of the nation depends on preserving and implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, its action programme.
					
					 Minju Joson states that it is the steadfast stand of the DPRK to expand and develop the inter-Korean relations and achieve the independent reunification, peace and prosperity by thoroughly implementing the inter-Korean declarations. The implementation of the declarations entirely depends on the stand and attitude of the south side, it says.

articles.title: Vigorous Reunification Movement of Korean Nation Urged
articles.content:
Vigorous Reunification Movement of Korean Nation Urged
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, released a statement titled "Let us more vigorously conduct the struggle to preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration to the last" on September. 25.
					The statement noted that the historic October 4 declaration, provided thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il's steadfast will for reunification and his wise guidance, is a reunification programme which indicated the wide avenue for achieving the development of the inter-Korean relations, peace on the Korean Peninsula, co-prosperity of the nation and the country's reunification on the basis of the main spirit of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 It is entirely the shining fruition of Kim Jong Il's steadfast idea of national independence and his noble patriotic will and wise leadership that hot wind of reunification swept across the country, which had been frozen with distrust and confrontation for more than half a century, and such advance has been made in the improvement of the north-south relations and the movement for peaceful reunification as it is today, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Nothing is more patriotic for the Koreans than to struggle for implementing the said declarations, the reunification programme common to the nation, true to the intention of Kim Jong Il, the sun of the nation and the lodestar of the national reunification.
					
					 The Korean residents in China will decisively smash the confrontation moves of the separatist forces totally denying the north-south declarations and running amuck to hinder the reconciliation and unity and independent reunification of the nation.
					
					 We will further strengthen the solidarity and alliance of overseas compatriots in the struggle for national reunification and demonstrate the fresh stamina of national unity to the whole world, thus fully discharging our historic mission and duty for the era and the nation.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged
 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea issued "Prerequisite to Settlement of Korean Question", the first issue of its bulletin, on the occasions of the 29th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 2nd publication anniversary of the October 4 declaration.
					 The bulletin contended that pullout of the U.S. forces from south Korea is a precondition for settling the Korean issue.
					
					 Saying that the June 15 joint declaration is a milestone for Korea's reunification and the October 4 declaration is an action programme for implementing it, the bulletin demanded that the U.S. forces be immediately withdrawn from south Korea to ensure the reunification of the Korean nation and the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the world.

articles.title: Feats of Kim Jong Il Lauded in Mexico
articles.content:
Feats of Kim Jong Il Lauded in Mexico
Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism released the 30th issue of its bulletin carrying a picture of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasions of the 64th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 83rd formation anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					 Noting that the Korean people call the WPK motherly party, the bulletin in an article titled "Motherly Party and Kim Jong Il" stressed that this call is unthinkable without Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who regards the idea of "The people are my God" as his motto, made sure that the all-embracing politics, the benevolent politics, was adopted as the main political mode of the WPK and has led the work for thoroughly applying it, the bulletin said.
					
					 His ceaseless on-site guidance is a vivid example proving his total devotion to the people, it said, specifying the fact that he has made an endless forced march for field guidance despite bitter cold weather in midwinter and burning sun or downpour in midsummer.
					
					 It introduced the fact that Kim Jong Il has shown special care to turn the WPK into the motherly party which looks after the people's destinies in a responsible manner and made sure that the desire and demands of the people are fully reflected when the WPK draws up even a line and policy.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Wen Jiabao 
  Pyongyang, 4 de octubre (ATCC) -- Llego el dia 4 por avion especial a esta capital Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, para realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC) por invitacion del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el gobierno de la RPDC.
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il acudio al Aeropuerto de Pyongyang para acogerlo cordialmente.
					
					  En la terminal aerea figuraban el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC Kim Yong Nam, el premier del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC Kim Yong Il, el vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Kim Yong Chun, el miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea Kim Jong Gak, el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC Ri Yong Ho, los secretarios del CC del PTC Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju, el embajador coreano en China Choe Jin Su y los funcionarios directivos de los organismos del partido y el Poder, los ministerios y organos centrales.
					
					  Tambien, estaban alli el embajador chino Liu Xiaoming y otros miembros de la embajada china en Corea, los huespedes y estudiantes chinos que permanecen en Corea.
					
					  A las 10 y 50 minutos, aterrizo en el aeropuerto el avion con la mision de amistad del pueblo chino a su bordo.
					
					  Kim Jong Il y Wen Jiabao se apretaron fuertemente las manos y se abrazaron cordialmente.
					
					  Vinieron junto con el premier chino el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi y otros acompanantes.
					
					  Tuvo lugar alli la ceremonia para dar bienvenida a Wen Jiabao.
					
					  Fueron interpretados los himnos nacionales de la RPCh y la RPDC.
					
					  Wen Jiabao junto con Kim Yong Il dio revista a la guardia de honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas del EPC.
					
					  Una artista coreana obsequio un ramo de flores al premier chino.
					
					  Acto seguido, junto con el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Kim Yong Nam y Kim Yong Il,  Wen Jiabao vio el desfile de la guardia de honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas del EPC.
					
					  El visitante chino respondio con la mano levantada a las efusivas aclamaciones de las masas que gritan "!Bienvenida a Wen Jiabao!" y "!Amistad Corea-China!".
					
					  El carro con Wen Jiabao a bordo se dirigio a la ciudad.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il junto con Wen Jiabao presencia opera
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il junto con Wen Jiabao presencia opera
  Pyongyang, 4 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, vio el dia 4 en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang la funcion de la opera "El sueno en la camara roja" junto con Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, quien realiza una visita oficial y de amistad a Corea. 
					  Cuando el Dirigente salio al hall de espectadores junto con el premier chino, todo el publico les dio calurosa bienvenida con los aplausos estruendosos.
					
					  A la funcion fueron invitados el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi y otros acompanantes, el embajador chino Liu Xiaoming y otros miembros de la embajada china en Corea y los huespedes chinos que permanecen en Corea.
					
					  Presenciaron el espectaculo el premier del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC Kim Yong Il, el vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares Kim Yong Chun, el miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea Kim Jong Gak, el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC Ri Yong Ho, los secretarios del CC del PTC Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC Yang Hyong Sop, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju, el embajador coreano en China Choe Jin Su, los funcionarios directivos de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, los ministerios y organos centrales, asi como trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					  Esta opera, creada y completada hace ahora casi 50 anos por la iniciativa y la direccion minuciosa del Presidente Kim Il Sung, se trata de la adaptacion de una famosa novela clasica de China.
					
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il asigno la tarea de recrear la opera "El sueno en la camara roja" en este "Ano de amistad Corea-China", dio en decenas de ocasiones las preciosas instrucciones e hizo recuperar esta obra, que podia desaparecer en medio de la corriente del tiempo, conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo.
					
					  La funcion de la opera, recreada por el Conjunto Operistico Mar de Sangre laureado con la Orden         Kim Il Sung reflejando fielmente la demanda de la obra original, fue objeto de efusivos aplausos de los espectadores por la gran habilidad artistica de los ejecutantes.
					
					  El Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el premier Wen Jiabao respondieron cordialmente con la mano levantada a las aclamaciones entusiastas de los ejecutantes y espectadores.
					
					  Wen Jiabao entrego un cesto de flores a los ejecutantes felicitandoles su exito.

articles.title: Wen Jiabao rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Wen Jiabao rinde homenaje a  Kim Il Sung 
  Pyongyang, 4 de octubre (ATCC) -- Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, rindio homenaje el dia 4 al Presidente Kim Il Sung en el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan.
					  Visitaron tambien este lugar supremo del Juche el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Xiaoming, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi y otros acompanantes.
					
					  Entre los acompanantes coreanos figuraban el primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea  Kim Yong Il, el vicecanciller Kim Yong Il y el embajador coreano acreditado en China Choe Jin Su.
					
					  Delante de la estatua de pie del Presidente Kim Il Sung fue depositado el cesto de flores a nombre de Wen Jiabao.
					
					El visitante rindio tributo lleno de testimonio de su veneracion al Presidente quien hizo gran aporte al fortalecimiento de la tradicional amistad Corea-China y al cumplimiento de la causa de la independencia en todo el mundo.
					
					  Seguidamente, el huesped chino dejo letras en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Pyongyaneses dan calurosa bienvenida a Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Pyongyaneses dan calurosa bienvenida a Wen Jiabao
 Pyongyang, 4 de octubre (ATCC) -- Los ciudadanos capitalinos dieron calurosa bienvenida a Wen Jiabao, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China.
					  A lo largo de la ruta de decenas de ri (10 ri equivale a 4 kilometros) que pasa por el puente de Sopho, la cruzada de Ryonghung, las avenidas de Kaesonmun, Mansudae, Yong-ung y Kumsong, cientos de miles de habitantes de distintos sectores acogieron a la mision de amistad del pueblo chino agitando los banderines de los dos paises, los ramos de flores y las consignas "Bienvenida y amistad" y "Amistad Corea-China".  
					
					  Cuando el carro con Wen Jiabao a su bordo se dirigio hacia las avenidas centrales de la ciudad, en la ruta se agitaron las olas de flores para darle bienvenida.
					
					  El ambiente de acogida se ascendio mas cuando el convoy de camiones con los huespedes chinos llego ante el Monumento a la Amistad.
					
					  La plaza del Arco Triunfal estaba repleta de numerosos ninos escolares.
					
					  Cuando el convoy llego a la plaza, sono el clarinazo de senal que da inicio a la ceremonia de la Union de Ninos de Corea.
					
					  A Wen Jiabao varios miembros de esta organizacion infantil le dieron ramos de flores, colgaron la corbata roja e hicieron el saludo de bienvenida en nombre de todos los miembros de la UNC.
					
					  Pasando las avenidas envueltas del ambiente de acogida los huespedes respondieron con la mano levantada a las aclamaciones de la muchedumbre.
					
					  En la plaza Jonsung un general y una militar del Ejercito Popular de Corea obsequiaron ramos de flores al premier chino.
					
					  Los habitantes enfilados a lo largo de la avenida de Pipha gritaron consignas de bienvenida y felicitaron calurosamente los exitos del pueblo chino logrados bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China en la lucha por construir la armoniosa sociedad socialista basada en la concepcion del desarrollo cientifico.
					
					  El convoy de los camiones con los misioneros de amistad del pueblo chino movio hacia la avenida de Kumsong por la ruta en que se eleva mas el ambiente de bienvenida.
					
					  Los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes enfilados a lo largo de la ruta les dieron aclamaciones gritando "Bienvenida a Wen Jiabao" y "Amistad Corea-China" y agitando banderines de los dos paises con el sentimiento de amistad al partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de China que presentaron como la orientacion estrategica el fortalecimiento de la amistad China-Corea y apoyan activamente la lucha del pueblo coreano por la construccion de la gran potencia prospera.
					
					  La escena de tal bienvenida mostro energicamente la invencible amistad Corea-China y la firme voluntad del pueblo coreano de apreciar y desarrollar la amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y China y marchar siempre mano a mano con el pueblo chino en la lucha por la victoria de la causa socialista y la realizacion de la independencia en todo el mundo.

articles.title: Firmados convenios y acuerdos entre Corea y China
articles.content:
Firmados convenios y acuerdos entre Corea y China
Pyongyang, 4 de octubre (ATCC) -- Fueron rubricados el dia 4 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae los convenios y acuerdos entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de la Republica Popular China.
					En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el premier del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Il, el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, el vicepremier y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion Ro Tu Chol, el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, el jefe del Secretariado del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Ho, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Pak Kyong Son, el vicecanciller Kim Yong Il, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae, el embajador coreano en China Choe Jin Su y otros funcionarios y por la china el primer ministro del Consejo de Estado Wen Jiabao, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion 
					
					 del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Xiaoming, el subsecretario general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei, el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi y otros acompanantes.
					
					Quedaron firmados el "Protocolo sobre el arreglo de los tratados entre los gobiernos de la RPDC y la RPCh", el "Convenio sobre la cooperacion economica y tecnica entre los gobiernos de la RPDC y la RPCh", los documentos intercambiados sobre la ayuda economica y otros acuerdos en este sector, el acuerdo sobre el intercambio y la cooperacion en el sector docente entre los Ministerios de Educacion de ambos paises, la nota de entendimiento sobre el intercambio y la cooperacion en el sector de la industria de Software, el protocolo sobre el control comun de los productos exportados e importados entre los organismos estatales de supervision de la calidad de productos la nota de entendimiento sobre la realizacion de turismo a la RPDC de la entidad turista y el acuerdo para fortalecer la cooperacion en la proteccion de los animales salvajes.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre los premieres de Corea y China
articles.content:
onversaciones entre los premieres de Corea y China
 Pyongyang, 4 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 4 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre Kim Yong Il, primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y Wen Jiabao, primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China.
					  A la cita asistieron por la parte coreana el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion Ro Tu Chol, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Pak Ui Chun, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, el director del Secretariado del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Ho, el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Pak Kyong Son, el vicecanciller Kim Yong Il, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae, y el embajador coreano acreditado en China Choe Jin Su, y por la china, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Yang Jiechi, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh Wang Jiarui, el ministro encargado de la Comision del Desarrollo Nacional y Reforma Zhang Ping, el ministro de Comercio Chen Deming, el ministro de Cultura Cai Wu, el director de la Oficina de Investigacion del Consejo de Estado Xie Fuzhan, el embajador chino Liu Xiaoming en Corea, el subsecretari
					
					 o general del Consejo de Estado y director de la oficina del premier Qiu Xiaoxiong, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Wu Dawei y el subdirector del Departamento Politico General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China Liu Zhenqi. 
					
					  En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron profundas opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar invariablemente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					  Ambas partes confirmaron que aunque se cambie la situacion y se sustituyan las generaciones, no podra alterarse la tradicional amistad Corea-China que prepararon personalmente los dirigentes de la vieja generacion de los dos paises.
					
					  La parte coreana reafirmo la posicion de ampliar y desarrollar mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la parte china en ocasion del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas Corea-China y el "Ano de amistad Corea-China".
					
					  Ambas partes intercambiaron criterios sinceros sobre los importantes problemas internacionales y regionales de interes mutuo.
					
					  La parte coreana enfatizo que la responsabilidad del surgimiento del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana reside en Estados Unidos y la desnuclearizacion de esta peninsula esta relacionada directamente con la desnuclearizacion de toda la Peninsula Coreana  y su contorno y, a la larga, con el resto del mundo y expreso la voluntad de realizar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, legado del Presidente Kim Il Sung, mediante el dialogo bilateral y multilateral.
					
					  La parte china dijo que durante los 60 anos pasados posteriores al establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas China-Corea, se han venido consolidando y desarrollando incesantemente en varios dominios las relaciones bilaterales de amistad y cooperacion y expreso agradecimiento al hecho de que la parte coreana dio apoyo a los problemas relacionados con los intereses medulares de China incluyendo los asuntos de Taiwan y Tibet.
					
					  La parte china enfatizo que el partido y el gobierno de China aprecian mucho la tradicional amistad con Corea y tienen la firme orientacion de seguir fortaleciendo las relaciones de buena vecindad, amistad y cooperacion con esta
					
					  Ambas partes acordaron ampliar y fortalecer la cooperacion y el intercambio en las esferas economica y comercial adhiriendose a los principios de la igualdad y el beneficio mutuo.
					
					  Tambien, llegaron a la identidad de criterios en lo tocante al problema de la construccion del nuevo puente en el rio Amnok y declararon oficialmente el inicio del trabajo correspondiente para que se efectuara lo mas pronto posible el acto de dar inicio a la construccion de nuevo puente y se terminara pronto esta obra. 
					
					  Las conversaciones se realizaron en un ambiente camaraderil y amistoso.
